alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Scott; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Hennepin, northwestern Dakota, northeastern Scott, southeastern Anoka, west central Washington and Ramsey Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 845 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bloomington, or 8 miles south of Minneapolis, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... MSP International Airport around 850 AM CDT. St. Louis Park, Golden Valley and Mendota Heights around 855 AM CDT. Minneapolis, St. Paul, Roseville, Brooklyn Center and Columbia Heights around 900 AM CDT. Maplewood, Fridley, Shoreview, New Brighton and Vadnais Heights around 905 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Blaine, Lino Lakes and Hugo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Anoka; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Scott; Washington
